conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The two cars are side by side at \\( t = 30 \\) seconds.
The task is to determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side.
The v-t graph shows Car A with a constant velocity of 40 m/s and Car B with a linear increase in velocity until 20 seconds and then a constant velocity of 40 m/s.
Car A and Car B are side by side at \\( t = 30 \\) seconds.
The graph shows that Car B reaches a velocity of 40 m/s at \\( t = 20 \\) seconds.
The graph shows that Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s.
At \\( t = 20 \\) seconds, Car B has traveled 400 meters and Car A has traveled 800 meters.
The relative distance between Car A and Car B at \\( t = 20 \\) seconds is 400 meters.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B occurs at \\( t = 20 \\) seconds, which is 400 meters.
